timeline.event: The earliest human settlements in the Netherlands date back to around 8000 BC.
The Romans establish control over parts of the Netherlands around 50 BC.
The formation of various feudal states and the rise of local nobility.
The Act of Abjuration is signed, declaring independence from Spanish rule.
The Dutch East India Company (VOC) is established, marking the start of Dutch colonial expansion.
The Dutch Republic faces the 'Disaster Year' with invasions from France and England.
The Batavian Revolution leads to the establishment of the Batavian Republic.
The Kingdom of the Netherlands is established after the defeat of Napoleon.
The Netherlands is occupied by Nazi Germany during World War II.
The Netherlands becomes a founding member of the European Economic Community (EEC).
The Euro is introduced as the official currency of the Netherlands.
The Netherlands is known for its progressive policies and active role in the European Union.
